document_data.name: Leather
document_data.mainbody: '''Leather''' was the processed hide or skin of an animal, widely used in [[Faerûn]] and beyond for various crafts. It was produced by tanners through the process of [[tanning]].
document_data.Description: Leather could be made from the skin of practically any animal, though each had their advantages and disadvantages. Some of the most common hides used came from [[cow]]s, [[ox]]en, [[rothé]], [[horse]]s, and [[donkey]]s, which had large and durable skins. The hides of [[deer]], [[wolves]], [[bear]]s, [[lion]]s, [[manticore]]s, and other beasts were also desirable, though harder to obtain. Scaly hides such as from [[bulette]]s, [[lizard]]s and [[dragon]]s could also be used like leather, but the product was quite different.
document_data.Production:
In some areas, the professions of skinners, tanners, and leatherworkers were controlled or regulated by trade [[guild]]s, like the [[League of Skinners and Tanners]] in [[Waterdeep]], which supplied the bulk of leather used by artisans of other guilds such as the [[Saddlers' and Harness-makers' Guild]], [[Order of Cobblers and Corvisers]], and [[Order of Master Tailors, Glovers, and Mercers]].

Tools used in leatherworking included the [[round knife]], the [[swivel knife]], and the [[awl]], which were each highly specialized tools adapted for carefully cutting leather.

Usage.Spell Components:
* ''[[Bigby's hand]]'' and its variants used a leather glove as a component.
* ''[[Displacement]]'' used a strip of [[displacer beast]] leather.
* ''[[Freedom of movement]]'' used a leather thong.
* ''[[Levitate]]'' could use a leather loop.
* ''[[Mage armor]]'' used a piece of cured leather.
* ''[[Suspension]]'' used a small leather loop hanging from a [[gold]] [[wire]].
